intro: Elatostema pubipes, commonly known as the hairy elatostema, is a member of the family Urticaceae, which includes nettle plants. It is a small, herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Elatostema pubipes is known for its ability to thrive in low-light conditions and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
